headline: Retail stocks slide, Tilray Brands earnings, Mattel downgrade
summary: Market Domination Host Josh Lipton and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma take a closer look at some of the trending tickers during Friday's session. Retail stocks, like Under Armour (UAA, UA), Kohl's (KSS), and Lululemon (LULU), fell after the US Supreme Court didn't release a final ruling on President Trump's tariff policies that was expected on Friday. Tilray Brands (TLRY) stock is in focus following the cannabis company's second quarter earnings results. Goldman downgrades its rating on Mattel stock (MAT) to Neutral. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Why Lululemon Stock Was Sliding Today
summary: A delay in the Supreme Court tariff ruling pushed the stock lower.

raw.headline: Why Lululemon Stock Was Sliding Today
raw.summary: A delay in the Supreme Court tariff ruling pushed the stock lower.

headline: Consumer sentiment rises to 4-month high, retail stocks drop
summary: Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including retail stocks' reactions to the Supreme Court delaying their decision on President Trump's tariff policies, US consumer sentiment rising to its highest level since September 2025, and TD Cowen analysts forecast Chevron (CVX) could see a $700 million per year boost from Venezuelan oil production (CL=F, BZ=F). Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Retail Stocks Fall on Supreme Court Tariff Disappointment
summary: Retail stocks were tumbling on Friday, reflecting investors' disappointment over the fact that the Supreme Court did not issue an opinion on the Trump administration’s tariff policies.  Of course, the court will release its opinion at some point, likely by the end of January.

headline: What Makes Lululemon (LULU) a Long-Term Compounder?
summary: Tapasya Fund, an investment management company, released its fourth quarter 2025 investor letter. A copy of the letter can be downloaded here. The firm celebrated its third anniversary in August 2025 and is happy with the fund’s performance. headline: The Bull Case For lululemon athletica (LULU) Could Change Following Chip Wilson’s Boardroom Challenge - Learn Why
summary: In late December 2025, lululemon athletica Inc. disclosed that founder Chip Wilson plans to nominate three independent director candidates and submitted a non‑binding proposal to declassify the board, while the company reiterated internally that daily operations and its existing growth strategy remain unchanged. This move adds another layer to lululemon’s ongoing leadership transition, as the board evaluates Wilson’s nominees amid an active CEO search and pressure from activist investor...
